profileAssertions.name: Basic Security Profile [1.1] Test Assertions
profileAssertions.description: This document contains the test assertions for the WS-I Basic Security Profile definition. These test assertions are used by the analyzer testing tool to determine if a Web service is conformant to the Basic Security Profile.
profileAssertions.conventions: The labels used for entry types in this document map one-to-one with the conformance targets from the profile document, but use a different convention for capitalization. For example, the conformance target SECURITY_HEADER corresponds to the entry type securityHeader.
profileAssertions.contributorText: Keith Stobie (Microsoft Corporation), Martin Gudgin (Microsoft Corporation),

specification.name: Web Services Security: SOAP Message Security
Web Services Security: X.509 Token Profile
Web Services Security: Username Token Profile
Web Services Security: Kerberos Token Profile
Web Services Security: SAML Token Profile
Web Services Security: Rights Expression Language (REL) Token Profile

artifact.description: The Basic Security Profile 1.0 requires support for SOAP 1.1 and HTTP 1.0 or 1.1.

testAssertion.context: For any secureEnvelope containing an encryptedKey or encryptedData.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A soap:Envelope containing encryption is not a valid SOAP envelope.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: No two "./self::soap:Envelope//*[@wsu:Id]" attributes have the same value.
testAssertion.failureMessage: Two wsu:Id attributes within a soap:Envelope have the same value.
More than one wsse:Security block exists in a soap:Header with the actor attribute omitted (i.e., it is the case that "count(./self::soap:Header/wsse:Security[count(@soap:actor)=0])>1".
Two or more wsse:Security elements are present in the soap:Header with the same value for the actor attribute.
A wsse:Security contains more than one wsu:Timestamp (i.e. it is the case that ./self::wsse:Security[count(wsu:Timestamp)>1]).
A wsu:Timestamp element does NOT contain exactly one wsu:Created child element (i.e., it is the case that "./self::wsu:Timestamp[count(wsu:Created)!=1]").
A wsu:Timestamp element contains more than one wsu:Expires child element (i.e., it is the case that "./self::wsu:Timestamp[count(wsu:Expires)>1]").

testAssertion.context: For any timestamp that contains an expires.
testAssertion.failureMessage: wsu:Created and wsu:Expires elements appear in an improper order within a wsu:Timestamp element.
A wsu:Timestamp contains child elements other than wsu:Created or wsu:Expires.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: "seconds-from-duration(./self::wsu:Created/text()) should not contain more than 3 digits to right of decimal."
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Created element contains more than three digits to the right of decimal.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: "seconds-from-duration(./self::wsu:Expires/text()) should not contain more than 3 digits to right of decimal."
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Expires element contains more than three digits to the right of decimal.

testAssertion.context: For any created that contains second values.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Created element has a seconds value greater than or equal to 60.

testAssertion.context: For any expires that contains second values.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Expires element has a seconds value greater than or equal to 60.
A wsu:Created element contains a ValueType attribute (i.e. it is the case that ./self::wsu:Created/@ValueType).
A wsu:Expires element contains a ValueType attribute (i.e. it is the case that ./self::wsu:Expires/@ValueType).

testAssertion.assertionDescription: The time value is in UTC format as specified by the XML Schema type (dateTime).
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Created element does NOT contain time instants in UTC format as specified by the XML Schema type (dateTime).

testAssertion.assertionDescription: The time value is in UTC format as specified by the XML Schema type (dateTime).
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsu:Expires element does NOT contain time instants in UTC format as specified by the XML Schema type (dateTime).

testAssertion.assertionDescription: The //[@wsu:Id=./self::wsse:Reference/@URI] is not a wsse:SecurityTokenReference element.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference element references a wsse:SecurityTokenReference.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: The //[@wsu:Id=./self::wsse:Reference/@URI] is not a wsse:Embedded element.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference element references a wsse:Embedded.
A wsse:Reference element does NOT contain a ValueType attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Reference/@ValueType").
A wsse:Reference element does NOT have a URI attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Reference/@URI").
A wsse:SecurityTokenReference contains an ds:KeyName (i.e., it is the case that "./self::wsse:SecurityTokenReference[ds:KeyName]").
A wsse:KeyIdentifier element does NOT contain a ValueType attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:KeyIdentifier[@ValueType]").

testAssertion.context: For any strKeyIdentifier that refers to a securityToken other than a samlToken.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:KeyIndetifier element does NOT contain a EncodingType attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:KeyIdentifier[@EncodingType]").

testAssertion.context: For any strKeyIdentifier that has an EncodingType attribute.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:KeyIdentifier element contains an EncodingType attribute that does NOT have a value of "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:KeyIdentifier[@EncodingType='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary']").

testAssertion.assertionDescription: "count(./self::wsse:Embedded/*)=1" AND the child is an internalSecurityToken.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Embedded element has zero or more than one security token child element (i.e. it is not the case that count(./self::wsse:Embedded/*)=1)
A wsse:Embedded element contains a wsse:SecurityTokenReference child element (i.e. it is the case that ./self::wsse:Embedded[wsse:SecurityTokenReference]).

testAssertion.context: For any strReference that is a descendant of a securityHeader.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference uses a shorthand XPointer does not reference any security tokens located in the same wsse:Security element.

testAssertion.context: For any strReference that is a descendant of an encryptedData.
testAssertion.assertionDescription: The wsse:Reference must not use a Shorthand XPointer to refer to a security token located in a wsse:Security element other than the wsse:Security element containing a reference to the xenc:Encrypted element that contains the wsse:Reference.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference uses a shorthand XPointer does not reference any security tokens located in the wsse:Security element that contains a reference to the wsse:Reference's containing xenc:Encrypted.
A wsse:Signature element includes an Enveloping Signature.
A wsse:Signature element is an Enveloped Signature.
A wsse:Signature element is not a Detached Signature.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: "boolean(./self::ds:Reference/@URI)=true()" and the value ./self::ds:Reference/@URI is a Shorthand XPointer Reference.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A ds:Reference element does not contain URI attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "boolean(./self::ds:Reference/@URI)=true()") or the value ./self:ds:Reference/@URI is not Shorthand XPointer Reference.
A ds:Reference element does NOT contain a ds:Transforms child element (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:Reference/ds:Transforms").
A ds:Transforms elements in the signature does NOT contain a ds:Transform child element (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:Transforms/ds:Transform").

testAssertion.context: For any sigTransform with an Algorithm attribute.

testAssertion.failureMessage: A ds:Transforms element in the signature does NOT have a ds:Transform element as its last child or the ds:Transform Element contains an Agorithm attribute is not one of "http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#" or "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#STR-Transform" or "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/XX/oasis-2004XX-wss-swa-profile-1.0#Attachment-Content-Signature-Transform" or "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/XX/oasis-2004XX-wss-swa-profile-1.0#Attachment-Complete-Signature-Transform" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:Transforms/child::*[last()]=./self::ds:Transforms/child::ds:Transform[last()]" or "./sel;f::ds:Transforms/child::*[last()][@Alorithm='http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#' or @Alorithm='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#STR-Transform' or @Alorithm='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/XX/oasis-2004XX-wss-swa-profile-1.0#Attachment-Content-Signature-Transform' or @Alorithm='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/XX/oasis-2004XX-wss-swa-profile-1.0#Attachment-Complete-Signature-Transform']").

testAssertion.context: For any sigTransform containing an Algorithm attribute with a value of "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#STR-Transform".
testAssertion.failureMessage: A ds:Transform element for a Security Token Dereferencing Transform does not contain a wsse:TransformationParameters child element containing a ds:CanonicalizationMethod child element (i.e. it is NOT the case that ./self::ds:Transform/wsse:TransformationParameters/ds:CanonicalizationMethod.

A ds:CanonicalizationMethod/@Algorithm attribute has a value other than "http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:CanonicalizationMethod[@Algorithm='http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#']").

A ds:DigestMethod element does not contain a Algorithm attribute or the Algorithm attribute does not contain the value "http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "boolean(./self::ds:DigestMethod[@Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1"])=true()").

A ds:SignatureMethod element does not contain a Algorithm attribute or the Algorithm attribute does not contain the value "http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#hmac-sha1" or "http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "boolean(./self::ds:SignatureMethod[@Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#hmac-sha1" or @Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1"])=true()").
A ds:SignatureMethod elements contains a ds:HMACOutputLength element as a child element (i.e., it is the case that "./self::ds:SignatureMethod/ds:HMACOutputLength").
A ds:KeyInfo element in a signature does NOT have exactly one child element (i.e., it is the case that "ds:Signature//ds:KeyInfo[count(child::*)!=1]").
A ds:KeyInfo element in a signature does NOT have a wsse:SecurityTokenReference child element (i.e., it is NOT the case that "ds:KeyInfo/wsse:SecurityTokenReference").
A ds:Signature element in the message contains a ds:Manifest element.(i.e., it is the case that "./self::ds:Signature[descendant::ds:Manifest]").
A ds:Signature element in the message contains an xenc:EncryptedData element.(i.e., it is the case that "./self::ds:Signature[descendant::xenc:EncryptedData]").
A wsse11:SignatureConfirmation element does not contain a wsu:Id attribute.
An xenc:EncryptedKey element does not precedes the xenc:EncryptedData element that is referenced by the associated xenc:ReferenceList element specified in the xenc:EncryptedKey.
A soap:Header element in a secure envelope contains a child xenc:EncryptedData element.
testAssertion.comments: BSP_11_NEW From the profile text, we could perhaps write this assertion more naturally using either secureEnvelope or soapHeader as the entryType. However, given the difficulty of expressing encryptedData in XPath (taking into account the requirement that it is referenced from an ekReferenceList or encReferenceList), we found it easier to write the assertion this way.

testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse11:EncryptedHeader element contains some number of children other than 1, or the child of the wsse11:EncryptedHeader element is not a valid xenc:EncryptedData
An xenc:EncryptedKey element does not contain xenc:ReferenceList child element.
An xenc:EncryptedKey elements in the security header contains a Type attribute (i.e., it is the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedKey[@Type]").
An xenc:EncryptedKey elements in the security header contains a MimeType attribute (i.e., it is the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedKey[@MimeType]").
An xenc:EncryptedKey elements in the security header contains a Encoding attribute (i.e., it is the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedKey[@Encoding]").
An xenc:EncryptedKey element contains a Recipient attribute (i.e., it is the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedKey[@Recipient]").
An xenc:EncryptedKey element does NOT contain an xenc:EncryptionMethod child element (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedKey[xenc:EncryptionMethod]").

testAssertion.context: For any encryptedData which is not referenced from an encryptedKey.
testAssertion.failureMessage: The xenc:EncryptedData element does not contain a ds:KeyInfo element (i.e. it is NOT the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedData[ds:KeyInfo]").

testAssertion.context: For any encryptedData in which the parent EncryptedHeader is missing the wsu:Id
testAssertion.failureMessage: The xenc:EncryptedData is missing the Id attribute

testAssertion.context: For any encryptedData in which the Id attribute is missing
testAssertion.failureMessage: The xenc:EncryptedHeader is missing the wsu:Id attribute

testAssertion.context: For any STR_KEY_IDENTIFIER that references an X509_TOKEN
testAssertion.failureMessage: The wsse:KeyIdentifier ValueType attribute is incorrect
An xenc:EncryptedData element does NOT contain an xenc:EncryptionMethod child element (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::xenc:EncryptedData[xenc:EncryptionMethod]").
A ds:KeyInfo element in an xenc:EncryptedKey does NOT have exactly one child element.(i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:KeyInfo[count(child::*)=1]").
A ds:KeyInfo element in an xenc:EncryptedKey does NOT contain a wsse:SecurityTokenReference child (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::ds:KeyInfo[wsse:SecurityTokenReference]").

testAssertion.assertionDescription: ./self::xenc:DataReference/@URI contains a Shorthand XPointer reference value based on the ID attribute of the referred to xenc:EncryptedData.
testAssertion.failureMessage: An xenc:DataReference refers to an xenc:EncryptedData without using a Shorthand XPointer reference based on its ID attribute.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: ./self::xenc:DataReference/@URI contains a Shorthand XPointer reference value based on the ID attribute of the referred to xenc:EncryptedData.
testAssertion.failureMessage: An xenc:DataReference refers to an xenc:EncryptedData without using a Shorthand XPointer reference based on its ID attribute.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: ./self::xenc:KeyReference/@URI contains a Shorthand XPointer reference value based on the ID attribute of the referred to xenc:EncryptedKey.
testAssertion.failureMessage: An xenc:KeyReference refers to an xenc:EncryptedKey without using a Shorthand XPointer reference based on its ID attribute.

testAssertion.assertionDescription: ./self::xenc:KeyReference/@URI contains a Shorthand XPointer reference value based on the ID attribute of the referred to xenc:EncryptedKey.
testAssertion.failureMessage: An xenc:KeyReference refers to an xenc:EncryptedKey without using a Shorthand XPointer reference based on its ID attribute.

A xenc:EncryptionMethod elements Algorithm attribute contains a value other than "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5" or "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p" or "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-tripledes" or "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes128" or "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes256".
The soap:Header has a xenc:EncryptedData element as its child.
A wsse:BinarySecurityToken does NOT contain a EncodingType attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:BinarySecurityToken[@EncodingType]").

A wsse:BinarySecurity tokens contains an EncodingType attribute with a value other than "http://www.docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd#Base64Binary" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:BinarySecurityToken[@EncodingType='http://www.docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd#Base64Binary']".
A wsse:BinarySecurityToken does NOT contain a ValueType attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:BinarySecurityToken[@ValueType]").

testAssertion.assertionDescription: ./self::wsse:BinarySecurityToken/@ValueType has a value specified by a related security token profile.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:BinarySecurityToken element has a ValueType attribute whose value is outside the defined token profiles.
A wsse:UsernameToken element contains more than one wsse:Password (i.e., it is NOT the case that "count(./self::wsse:UsernameToken/wsse:Password)<=1").
A wsse:Password element does NOT contain a Type attribute (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Password/@Type").
A wsse:UsernameToken element contains more than one wsu:Created (i.e., it is NOT the case that "count(./self::wsse:UsernameToken/wsu:Created)<=1").
A wsse:UsernameToken element contains more than one wsse:Nonce (i.e., it is NOT the case that "count(./self::wsse:UsernameToken/wsse:Nonce)<=1").
A wsse:Nonce does NOT contain an EncodingType attribute (i.e, it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Nonce/@EncodingType").

A wsse:Nonce contains an EncodingType attribute that does NOT have a value "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Nonce[@EncodingType='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary']").

testAssertion.context: For any strReference to a usernameToken.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference element that refers to a wsse:UsernameToken does not have a ValueType attribute of "http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-username-token-profile-1.0#UsernameToken" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::wsse:Reference[@ValueType='http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-username-token-profile-1.0#UsernameToken'").
testAssertion.comments: Because of R5204, we can assume that the strReference uses a Shorthand XPointer URI, and so we can always determine if a strReference references a usernameToken.

testAssertion.context: For any strReference that refers to an internalSecurityToken that is an relToken containing a wsu:Id attribute.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:Reference element that refers to an rel:license element can use the shorthand XPointer format but does not.

testAssertion.context: For any strKeyIdentifier that references an internalSamlToken.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:KeyIdentifier element that references an internalSamlToken does not contain a ValueType attribute (i.e. it is NOT the case that ./self::wsse:KeyIdentifier[@ValueType]).

testAssertion.context: For Any strKeyIdentifier that references a samlToken.
testAssertion.failureMessage: A wsse:KeyIdentifier that references a saml:Assertion includes an EncodingType attribue (i.e., it IS the case that "boolean(./self::wsse:KeyIdentifier[@EncodingType])=false()"

testAssertion.context: For any samlAuthorityBinding that contains an AuthorityKind attribute.
testAssertion.failureMessage: The AuthorityKind attribute in saml:AuthorityBinding element does NOT contain the value "saml:AssertionIdReference" (i.e., it is NOT the case that "./self::saml:AuthorityBinding[@AuthorityKind='saml:AssertionIdReference']").

testAssertion.context: For a message obtained by reversing the SOAP Messsage Security of any secure message.
testAssertion.failureMessage: Not testable.
testAssertion.comments: These restrictions are intended to clarify BP1.0 and BP1.1 statements that might be unclear when SOAP Message Security is applied in compliance with the Basic Security Profile.

testAssertion.context: These assertions provide guidance for protecting attachements when they are used with SOAP Messages.
testAssertion.failureMessage: Not testable.
Not testable.
testAssertion.comments: All of these profile requirements are NOT testable. Some of these test assertions represent capabilities which can not be validated.

testAssertion.context: For any secure envelope containing a wsse:SecurityTokenReference element.
testAssertion.assertionDescription: For each token referenced by the wsse:SecurityTokenReference get the referenced token and check if it is in the additional token profile.
